meanings.definition: To uproot or remove from a place.
meanings.sent1: The gardener was displanting the flowers to make room for new ones.
meanings.sent2: The storm caused the displanting of many trees in the area.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was caught displanting the acorns from the garden into its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The construction work was displanting the peace and quiet of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The act of displanting the old memories allowed for new beginnings to take root.

meanings.sent1: The flood displanted many families from their homes.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to displant its headquarters to a different city.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved displanting objects to different parts of the stage.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind displanted the sand dunes along the coast.
meanings.sent5: The decision to displant the event to a larger venue was met with excitement.

meanings.sent1: The chef was displanting the ingredients from one bowl to another.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to displant the incorrect answers and write the correct ones.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat kept displanting the toys from the child's room to the living room.
meanings.sent4: The technology upgrade required displanting the data from the old system to the new one.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes seemed to displant colors from one canvas to another.
